altTitles.ja: 集英社 学習まんが 世界の歴史

altTitles.ja-ro: Shueisha Gakushuu Manga Sekai no Rekishi

description.en:
The history is a story.
Manga Shueisha makes it fun and easy to understand!
A definitive edition complying with latest study program, this is the newest manga for learning history!

### **Content:**
**Volume 1:** Orient and Mediterranean Civilizations: Egypt, Mesopotamia, Greece
Cover: **Yasuhisa Hara**
Art: **Akio Kikuchi**
Story: **Takashi Kondo**
Supervision: **Keisuke Takai**

**Volume 2:** Beginning of Chinese Civilization and the Chinese Empire: Yellow River Civilization to Tang Dynasty
Cover: **Hiroyuki Asada**
Art: **Sonoko Azuma**
Story: **Takatoshi Akagi**
Supervision: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volume 3:** The Glory of the Great Roman Empire: Ancient Rome and Byzantium
Cover: **Kouhei Horikoshi**
Art: **Takashi Kondou**
Story: **Takashi Kondou**
Supervision: **Hajime Tanaka**

**Volume 4:** Islamic World and India: Rise and Fall of Dynasties and Religions:
Cover: **Kozueko Morimoto**
Art: **Yoshida Kenji**
Story: **Taeko Higashi, Ryouichi Kazeno, Ryou Komae**
Supervision: **Taisuke Kouno**

**Volume 5:** Development of Christianity and Europe: Medieval Europe
Cover: **Yuuki Tabata**
Art: **Takashi Kondou**
Story: **Takashi Kondou**
Supervision: **Makoto Katou**

**Volume 6:** Mongols and East Asia: Song dynasty to early Qing dynasty and Korea
Cover: **Fusako Kuramochi**
Art: **Tetsuo Aoki**
Story: **Ryou Komae**
Supervision: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volume 7:** Renaissance and Reformation: Modern Europe
Cover: **Posuka Demizu**
Art: **Yotarou Noma**
Story: **Tadashi Ikuta**
Supervision: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volume 8:** European Sovereign States: Absolute Monarchy and Enlightenment Despotism
Cover: **Io Sakisaka**
Art: **Ootsuki Belluno**
Story: **Tadashi Ikuta, Kenji Ishikawa**
Supervision: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volume 9:** Industrial Revolution and American Independence: Beginning of Capitalism
Cover: **Hikaru Miyoshi**
Art: **Takanori Yasaka**
Story: **Wada Natsuko**
Supervision: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volume 10:** French Revolution and the road to nation-state: Awakening of freedom, human rights, and independence
Cover: **Hirohiko Araki**
Art: **Toriru (Trill)**
Story: **Chiaki Takayama**
Supervision: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volume 11:** Progress of Modernization and Imperialism: Powers and Colonial Expansion
Cover: **Yuusei Matsui**
Art: **Naoto Satta**
Story: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervision: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volume 12:** Opium War and Xinhai Revolution: From Late Qing Dynasty to Republic of China
Cover: **Masanori Morita**
Art: **Tomomi Usui**
Story: **Ryou Komae**
Supervision: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volume 13:** WWI and Russian Revolution: From Total War to International Cooperation
Cover: **Satoru Noda**
Art: **Shuji Takeda**
Story: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervision: **Akira Ookubo**

**Volume 14:** Mass Political Participation and Great Depression: Prosperity and Turmoil during Interwar Period
Cover: **Shinichi Sakamoto**
Art: **Shuji Takeda**
Story: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervision: **Takumi Itabashi**

**Volume 15:** WWII and United Nations: Greatest Sacrifice in Human History
Cover: **Tatsuya Endo**
Art: **Aki Jujou**
Story: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervision: **Yuichiro Miyashita**

**Volume 16:** Cold War and East-West Conflict: Two Superpowers and a Third Force
Cover: **Shinichi Sakamoto**
Art: **Mihachi Kagano**
Story: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervision: **Hosoya Yuuichi**

**Volume 17:** A Multipolar World: Asia, Europe, Middle East and Africa
Cover: **Mari Yamazaki**
Art: **Yuuka Sakaki**
Story: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervision: **Hosoya Yuuichi**

**Volume 18:** Globalization Progress: 21st Century Challenges
Cover: **Pozuka Demisu**
Art: **RICCA**
Story: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervision: **Hiroyuki Ogawa**
description.es:
La historia es un relato.
¡Manga Shueisha la hace divertida y fácil de entender!
Una edición definitiva que cumple con el último programa de estudios, ¡este es el manga más novedoso para aprender historia!

### **Contenido:**
**Volumen 1:** Oriente y Civilizaciones Mediterráneas: Egipto, Mesopotamia, Grecia
Portada: **Yasuhisa Hara**
Ilustración: **Akio Kikuchi**
Historia: **Takashi Kondo**
Supervisión: **Keisuke Takai**

**Volumen 2:** Inicio de la civilización China y el Imperio Chino: Civilización del Río Amarillo a la Dinastía Tang
Portada: **Hiroyuki Asada**
Arte: **Sonoko Azuma**
Historia: **Takatoshi Akagi**
Supervisión: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volumen 3:** La gloria del Gran Imperio Romano: Antigua Roma y Bizancio
Portada: **Kouhei Horikoshi**
Ilustración: **Takashi Kondou**
Historia: **Takashi Kondou**
Supervisión: **Hajime Tanaka**

**Volumen 4:** El mundo islámico y la India: Auge y declive de dinastías y religiones
Portada: **Kozueko Morimoto**
Ilustración: **Yoshida Kenji**
Historia: **Taeko Higashi, Ryouichi Kazeno, Ryou Komae**
Supervisión: **Taisuke Kouno**

**Volumen 5:** Desarrollo del Cristianismo y Europa: Europa Medieval
Portada: **Yuki Tabata**
Arte: **Takashi Kondou**
Historia: **Takashi Kondou**
Supervisión: **Makoto Katou**

**Volumen 6:** Los mongoles y Asia Oriental: Dinastía Song a principios de la dinastía Qing y Corea
Portada: **Fusako Kuramochi**
Arte: **Tetsuo Aoki**
Historia: **Ryou Komae**
Supervisión: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volumen 7:** Renacimiento y Reforma Protestante: Europa Moderna
Portada: **Posuka Demizu**
Arte: **Yotarou Noma**
Historia: **Tadashi Ikuta**
Supervisión: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volumen 8:** Estados soberanos europeos: Monarquía Absoluta y Despotismo Ilustrado
Portada: **Io Sakisaka**
Arte: **Ootsuki Belluno**
Historia: **Tadashi Ikuta, Kenji Ishikawa**
Supervisión: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volumen 9:** Revolución Industrial e Independencia Americana: Inicio del Capitalismo
Portada: **Hikaru Miyoshi**
Ilustración: **Takanori Yasaka**
Historia: **Wada Natsuko**
Supervisión: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volumen 10:** La Revolución Francesa y el camino hacia el Estado-nación: El despertar de la libertad, los derechos humanos y la independencia
Portada: **Hirohiko Araki**
Arte: **Toriru (Trill)**
Historia: **Chiaki Takayama**
Supervisión: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volumen 11:** El Progreso de la Modernización y el Imperialismo: Potencias y Expansión Colonial
Portada: **Yuusei Matsui**
Arte: **Naoto Satta**
Historia: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervisión: **Naotaka Kimizuka**

**Volumen 12:** La Guerra del Opio y Revolución Xinhai: De finales de la dinastía Qing a la República de China
Portada: **Masanori Morita**
Ilustración: **Tomomi Usui**
Historia: **Ryou Komae**
Supervisión: **Kiyohiko Sugiyama**

**Volumen 13:** La Primera Guerra Mundial y la Revolución Rusa: De la guerra total a la cooperación internacional
Portada: **Satoru Noda**
Arte: **Shuji Takeda**
Historia: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervisión: **Akira Ookubo**

**Volumen 14:** Participación política de masas y la Gran Depresión: Prosperidad y agitación durante el periodo de entreguerras
Portada: **Shinichi Sakamoto**
Arte: **Shuji Takeda**
Historia: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervisión: **Takumi Itabashi**

**Volumen 15:** La Segunda Guerra Mundial y las Naciones Unidas: El mayor sacrificio en la historia de la humanidad
Portada: **Tatsuya Endo**
Arte: **Aki Jujou**
Historia: **Yoneo Shibata**
Supervisión: **Yuichiro Miyashita**

**Volumen 16:** La Guerra Fría y Conflicto Este-Oeste: Dos superpotencias y una tercera fuerza
Portada: **Shinichi Sakamoto**
Ilustración: **Mihachi Kagano**
Historia: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervisión: **Hosoya Yuuichi**

**Volumen 17:** Un mundo multipolar: Asia, Europa, Oriente Medio y África
Portada: **Mari Yamazaki**
Arte: **Yuuka Sakaki**
Historia: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervisión: **Hosoya Yuuichi**

**Volumen 18:** El Progreso de la globalización: Retos del siglo XXI
Portada: **Pozuka Demisu**
Arte: **RICCA**
Historia: **Yoshio Nabeta**
Supervisión: **Hiroyuki Ogawa**
description.ja:
歴史(ヒストリー)は物語(ストーリー)。
“まんがの集英社”だから、おもしろくてわかりやすい!
最新の学習指導要領に対応した、どこよりも新しい歴史学習まんがの決定版!

【各巻の内容】
第1巻 オリエントと地中海の文明≪エジプト・メソポタミア・ギリシア≫
第2巻 中国文明の始まりと中華帝国≪黄河文明から唐≫
第3巻 巨大帝国ローマの栄光≪古代ローマ・ビザンツ≫
第4巻 イスラーム世界とインド≪王朝の興亡と宗教≫
第5巻 キリスト教とヨーロッパの発展≪中世ヨーロッパ≫
第6巻 モンゴルと東アジア≪宋から清前期、朝鮮≫
第7巻 ルネサンスと宗教改革≪近世ヨーロッパ≫
第8巻 ヨーロッパの主権国家≪絶対王政と啓蒙専制君主≫
第9巻 産業革命とアメリカの独立≪資本主義の始まり≫
第10巻 フランス革命と国民国家への道≪自由、人権、独立への目覚め≫
第11巻 近代化の進展と帝国主義≪列強と植民地の拡大≫
第12巻 アヘン戦争と辛亥革命≪清後期から中華民国≫
第13巻 第一次世界大戦とロシア革命≪総力戦から国際協調へ≫
第14巻 大衆の政治参加と世界恐慌≪繁栄と動揺の戦間期≫
第15巻 第二次世界大戦と国際連合≪人類史上最大の犠牲≫
第16巻 冷戦と東西対立≪ふたつの超大国と第三勢力≫
第17巻 多極化する世界≪アジア・ヨーロッパ・中東・アフリカ≫
第18巻 進むグローバル化≪21世紀の課題≫

biography.en:
Horikoshi first attracted attention in the second half of 2006 when he entered Shueisha's 72th Tezuka Award for Newcomers with his one shot "Nukegara" and made it to the final six, where he gained himself an "Honorable Mention".
Various short stories in Shueisha's Akamaru Jump followed over the years until he published his one shot Oumagadoki Doubutsuen in issue #2/2010 of Weekly Shounen Jump. In the same year he got the serialization of this one shot.

After some time he published a new one shot Sensei no Barrage in Jump Next!, and in 2012 he got serialization of it. In this year he gained some popularity also worldwide, like in USA and in Europe.

In 2014 he started Boku no Hero Academia, basing the series on some concepts from an old one-shot, and briefly the series became a very big hit, generating a franchise and winning some national and international prizes.

He was assistant of TANAKA Yasuki.

MIYOKAWA Masaru, WATANABE Chihiro and SHIBATA Yusaku were his assistants during Oumagadoki Doubutsuen.
HORIE Ryuu and AKIYAMA Yoco were once his assistant on Hero Academia.
While NEDA Hirofumi and OOTAKE Toshitomo has worked as his assistant on both series.

He stated that OSADA Yu-Ko is one of his influences, Horikoshi also stated, that Osada’s drawings are the complete form of shounen manga.

He used to send One Piece fanart, his artwork once included in the Usopp Gallery Pirates of volume 23.

He started reading American comics after the movie Spider-Man by Sam Raimi came out in 2002.
He has a sister.

**Hirohiko Araki** (荒木 飛呂彦, born June 7, 1960) is a Japanese manga artist. He is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, which was first published in Weekly Shōnen Jump in 1987 and has sold over 100 million copies as of 2016 in Japan alone.

Araki participated in the Junior Baseball Team in primary school and Kendo Club in middle school. He has a pair of twin younger sisters. Because he was often bullied by his sister, he would hide away to read manga. He liked manga when he was a child, so he wants to be a manga artist. His favorite works are Star of the Giants by Kajiwara Ikki , and Babel II by Yokoyama. Araki had the experience of shaking hands with Tezuka Osamu.

He likes western pop music, horror movies and Italy very much. We can see a lot of the above elements in his representative work JOJO.His painting style was influenced by Renaissance paintings, especially Michelangelo.

He gets up at 10 a.m. every day, draws a Name on Sunday, finishes the draft from Monday to Thursday, rests on Friday and Saturday, and doesn't stay up late. This work and rest lasted more than ten years . The work and rest of this law is influenced by the manga artist [Akimoto Osamu](https://mangadex.org/author/1cd79d33-68b3-4879-b67a-834055ef99eb/akimoto-osamu). Although he is over 50, his face does not show his old state. He is even joked by other manga artists and fans as "the younger he lives", "Immortality", "using corrugation or stone ghost face", "in fact, he is also a Stand, and his ability is that he will not grow old".

**Native name**: 三好輝

Formerly an assistant to [Shinkiba Yuki](https://mangadex.org/author/5f7636c1-a11b-4ba3-b002-32f95ba363fc).

Worked as assistant to [Inoue Takehiko](https://mangadex.org/author/0b59098f-13c0-41cb-a110-9cbcec72dc0c/inoue-takehiko) on [Real](https://mangadex.org/title/62b74aa6-24df-4b91-b76d-39e7ab3c3ca5/real) & [Vagabond](https://mangadex.org/title/d1a9fdeb-f713-407f-960c-8326b586e6fd/vagabond).

Among his assistants during [Kingdom](https://mangadex.org/title/077a3fed-1634-424f-be7a-9a96b7f07b78/kingdom) there were [Ishida Sui](https://mangadex.org/author/c9d25993-e84a-4b77-b1e1-276e0257a0c5/ishida-sui), [Kasahara Masaki](https://mangadex.org/author/9ededc25-88f5-476c-8555-48e5a51c7054/kasahara-masaki), [Matsubara Toshimitsu](https://mangadex.org/author/f21ab69d-cb1b-4bc5-a337-cb78f4a9f13d/matsubara-toshimitsu), [Tajika Kouhei](https://mangadex.org/author/0e280d4f-5bfd-48db-bf79-2dd86644a45f/tajika-kouhei) & [Hakoishi Tooru](https://mangadex.org/author/8ff47c34-627c-4938-9800-b14a2b14f761/hakoishi-tooru).

[Tatsuzawa Katsumi](https://mangadex.org/author/99e4de40-39d2-4ee8-acfa-ba28be73e59b/tatsuzawa-katsumi) is his senior. 

Associated Names :
Hara-sensei
Yasuhisa Hara
原泰久

Name (in native language) :
原泰久

**Alt names**:
Endo Tatsuya
遠藤達哉

Native name: 野田サトル

Was working as manga assistant for 10 years before his debut.

He used to be the assistant of Kunitomo Yasuyuki and Kubo Mitsurou.

Shin-ichi Sakamoto (Japanese: 坂本眞一, Hepburn: Sakamoto Shin-ichi, born July 19, 1972) is a Japanese manga artist known for his seinen manga series Kokou no Hito and the Innocent duology. Both Kokou no Hito and Innocent were awarded an Excellence Award at the Japan Media Arts Festival. His newest series #DRCL midnight children began serialization in Grand Jump in 2021.
